txt.en: 'Perhaps not.'
'We will not know until someone sails to Gondor and presents them with this choice.'
Talk to the guard within the Citadel of Winds
Nakási Wave-reaper
'Imilka hid her allegiance to the Heirs of Castamir from us.'
'It is only right that Tatháta take her place at our council.'
TBD - Blah!
'Calm yourselves, my friends. Remember why this Kindred was formed.'
'This meeting of our council is dismissed.'
Your husband Tumúldo meets with the other members of the Kindred of the Coins within the Citadel of Winds.
'Tumúldo, wait a moment, if you would.'
The Kindred of the Coins debate your presence within the Citadel of Winds.
'I would like to speak with you and with Nakási.'
'TBD - Blah!'
You must <rgb=#00FF00>think</rgb> upon this question: did the Kindred of the Coins live up to its intention?
'Only those I can trust.'
TBD - Blah!
The other members of the Kindred leave their meeting, but you and Tumúldo stay behind.
'Hármelak believes it will not be finished in time.'
Azagath desires to speak with you and Tumúldo about a secret matter.
'And Khôltekh thinks it will not be enough.'
'TBD - Blah!'
Ever was Tumúldo your stable rock, even when the days were frightening and the nights long and terrible.
There was something you wanted to tell your husband, but now you cannot remember what it could have been.
Your fear, your anger, and your loneliness dissolves away into the darkness.
Your fear, your anger, and your loneliness are gone at last
One of the guards within the Citadel of Winds thinks to bar your passage to the chamber where meet the Kindred of the Coins.
'Until next we meet, then.'
'The Kindred of the Coins was formed to free Umbar from its masters.'
'We possessed our differences, but always we held to that mission.'
'Did we not?'
'No, Tumúldo... sail not to Gondor!'
'Yes, my love. Let us sail beyond the darkness of this life.'
'Your numbers will be fewer if you try to keep my wife from me.'
'Very well, Captain.'
'Anything you say to me you can say to Nakási as well.'
'But this is your doing, not mine.'
'It would appear so. We already have a Gondorian on this council!'
'Very well, Azagath. You have our attention.'
'Who else knows about this fleet?'
'Can it be that Gondor will choose peace?'
'It may not be necessary to release the Song.'
'You will come with me, my love. The waves will never part us.'
'Where my husband goes, I go.'
'Together we will learn if Gondor desires peace.'
'Do you believe you can prevent me from joining Tumúldo?'
'What is happening? Tumúldo, where have you gone?'
'Can we not remain here together? I have missed you so.'
'There was something I wanted to tell you...'
'But now I cannot remember... what it was...'
Nakási Wave-reaper sails upon the waters of memory, unknown to all but her.
'It is time to go, Nakási.'
'Every ship must leave the shore someday.'
'Ours must now depart, my love.'
Enter the chamber where your husband Tumúldo meets with the other members of the Kindred
Stand beside Tumúldo while the Kindred of the Coins discusses your presence
<rgb=#00FF00>Think</rgb> upon this question: did the Kindred of the Coins live up to its intentions?
Stay with Tumúldo as the rest of the Kindred departs
Talk to Azagath about a secret matter
Remain with Tumúldo for as long as you can
Take his hand and face whatever comes
'Hold, Azagath. These are Kindred matters.'
Instance: First Verse, Last Verse
'Our number is seven, not eight. Nakási cannot stay.'
'Are any welcome to join this Kindred, then?'
'What do you believe, my friends?'
'Say so once more, Tumúldo, and I will take your other hand!'
